title: News and communications
description: To tell users about something government has done or will do. For example, news stories, press releases, speeches, or statements.

types.title: News story
types.description: News written for GOV.UK which users need, can act on, and cannot get from other sources.

types.title: Press release
types.description: Unedited press releases as sent to the media, and official statements from the organisation.

types.title: Speech
types.description: A significant speech by a minister or official.

types.title: Statement to Parliament
types.description: A written or oral statement made to Parliament.

types.title: Oral statement to Parliament
types.description: Oral statements made to Parliament by a minister, where there is significant public interest in the entire statement.

types.title: Written statement to Parliament
types.description: Written statements given to Parliament by a minister, where there is significant public interest in the entire statement.

types.title: Articles and correspondence
types.description: For examples, something something hint text.

types.title: Authored article
types.description: Bylined articles writtenin the name of a minister or official, usually republished from elsewhere.

types.title: Correspondence
types.description: Ministerial or departmental responses (eg to campaign letters), announcements, or statements;regularly issued circulars or bulletins (eg fire service circulars), official correspondence to professionals (eg “Dear chief planning officer” letters);letters to individuals or organisations that are published to share with a wider audience than their original recipient;online versions of e-bulletins or newsletters. Do not use for: minutes, agendas or other meeting papers. Attach them to relevant “policy detail”, “team” or “our governance” pages instead.

types.title: Decision
types.description: Formal decisions by tribunals, regulators or adjudicators (including courts and Secretaries of State).

types.title: Fatality notice
types.description: Initial fatality notices and subsequent obituaries of forces and MOD personnel.

title: Guidance and regulation
description: To help the user do something or understand what they need to do. For example, manuals, or statutory guidance.

types.title: Guidance
types.description: Guidance help text, includes statuatory guidance and guidance.

types.title: Guidance
types.description: Non-statutory guidance publications. Includes: manuals, handbooks and other documents that offer advice. Do not use for: statutory guidance (use the “statutory guidance” publication type) or guidance about completing a form (attach to same publication as the form itself).

types.title: Statutory guidance
types.description: Guidance which relevant users are legally obliged to follow. (For non-statutory guidance publications, use the “guidance” sub-type).

types.title: Manuals
types.description: EMPTY

types.title: Notice
types.description: Permit and license applications published temporarily for public awareness.

types.title: Regulation
types.description: Regulations imposed by an independent regulatory authority.

types.title: Form
types.description: Form documents that need to be completed by the users.

types.title: Map
types.description: Drawn maps and geographical data.

title: Transparency and statistics
description: To provide information that helps users hold government to account. For example, statistics, FOI data, or reports.

types.title: Official statistics
types.description: Statistics governed by the UK Statistics Authority and produced by members of the Government Statistical Service.

types.title: National statistics
types.description: Official Statistics that have been produced in accordance with the Code of Practice for Official Statistics, which is indicated using the National Statistics quality mark.

types.title: Independent report
types.description: Reviews, inquiries and other reports commissioned from or conducted by independent (ie non-governmental) bodies for consideration by the government.

types.title: FOI release
types.description: Responses to Freedom of Information requests. Ensure the title describes specifically what the request is about.

types.title: Corporate report
types.description: Publications about what an organisation does (eg business plans, annual reports, accounts), or any plans that affect the organisation (eg structural reform plans, efficiency reviews). Corporate reports are shown automatically on the organisation’s “What we do” page.

types.title: Transparency
types.description: Information made available about departmental operations with the intent of making government more transparent.Includes organisation charts, staff survey results, departmental spending, salaries, contracts, meetings with ministers, etc. Do not use for: FOI responses.

title: Policy or consultation
description: To explain the government’s position or request views or evidence on an issue. For example, policy papers, impact assessments, or case studies

types.title: Policy paper
types.description: A policy paper explains the government's position on something. It doesn’t include instructions on how to carry out a task, only the policy itself and how it’ll be implemented.

types.title: Impact assessment
types.description: Cost-benefit analyses and other assessments of the impact of proposed initiatives, or changes to regulations or legislation.

types.title: Consultation
types.description: Consultations (officially “documents requiring collective agreement across government”, including calls for evidence).

title: I’m not sure if this should be on GOV.UK
description: View this guide to see what should go on GOV.UK and where else you can publish content
